info.name: Water Primordial Element
info.description: Water Primordial Element for the Elementalist class from Tanares RPG 5e.
info.author: Dragori Games

description.p: Elementalists who choose this Primordial Element are strongly attached to peace, tradition, restoration, and wisdom. By choosing water as your Primordial Element you can learn Water, Air and Earth spells, the latter two being your secondary elements, and you will know the fusion element spells of Plant and Spirit.

sheet.description: Your Primary element is Water. Air and Earth elements are your secondary elements. Plant and Spirit are your fusion elements.

description.p: At 1st level, the tradition and wisdom of water enable you to gain new abilities. You gain proficiency with two skills of your choice from Medicine, Nature, and Religion. Additionally, each time you cast an elementalist spell that heals a creature, you can also heal another creature up to 60 feet away, provided it was not healed by the original spell. The creature healed through this trait regains 1d6 hit points per level of the spell used.

sheet.description: Each time you cast an elementalist spell that heals a creature, you can also heal another creature up to 60 feet away, provided it was not healed by the original spell. The creature healed through this trait regains 1d6 hit points per level of the spell used.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, your understanding of the life-sustaining flow of water allows you to adapt to adversity. While conscious and not wearing armor or wielding a shield, your Wisdom modifier is added to all saving throws you make, in addition to any other applicable modifiers.

sheet.description: While conscious and not wearing armor or wielding a shield, your Wisdom modifier {{wisdom:modifier}} is added to all saving throws you make, in addition to any other applicable modifiers.

description.p: Starting at 10th level, as a bonus action, you can call forth a 30-foot radius rainstorm at a point up to 240 feet away, lasting for 1 minute. Upon activating this ability, you and your allies within the area recover 2d8 hit points each, and any conditions, diseases, or curses affecting them are removed. For the duration, you and your allies in the area have advantage on all saving throws. This ability has no effect on undead and constructs. After using this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

description.p: At 14th level, you can unleash the healing powers of water in a surge of vitality. As a bonus action, you create a 60-foot emanation around you that lasts for 1 minute. During this time, you and all creatures who finish their turn within the area recover hit points equal to your elementalist level. Additionally, any healing spells cast on a creature within the area recover extra hit points equal to your elementalist level. This ability has no effect on undead and constructs. After using this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.
